hadiths.text: It was narrated that Usamah bin Zaid said:“I departed from ‘Arafat with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), and when he reached the mountain path at which the chiefs would dismount, he dismounted and urinated, then performed ablution. I said: ‘(Is it time for) prayer?’ He said: ‘The prayer is still ahead of you.’ When he reached Jam’ (Muzdalifah) he called the Adhan and Iqamah, then he prayed Maghrib. Then no one among the people unloaded (the camels) until he had prayed ‘Isha’.”

chapter.ara-name: باب النُّزُولِ بَيْنَ عَرَفَاتٍ وَجَمْعٍ لِمَنْ كَانَتْ لَهُ حَاجَةٌ
chapter.eng-name: Stopping between `Arafat and Muzdalifah for one who has a need
